episode_title: 820 - The One With The Baby Shower

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for Rachel’s baby shower.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what’s the final head count on my baby shower?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: About twenty, a couple people from work who had something else to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Also both of your sisters called and neither can make it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! You mean they’re not coming to a social event where there’s no men and there’s no booze?! That’s shocking! I don’t care, as long as my mom’s here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, your mother!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! My mom’s not gonna be here?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, given that we forgot to invite her it would be an awfully big coincidence if she was.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well it wasn’t my fault, Phoebe was in charge of the invitations!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I don’t, I don’t have a mother so often I forget that other people…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh give it a rest!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So my mother is not coming to my baby shower?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. (Pause) Neither is mine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, y’know what? Don’t worry, okay? We’ll take care of it. We’ll call her. Just go home and get ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please, make sure she comes. It’s really important to me, I mean it’s my mom!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. I know, what’s her number?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go! I have it in my book. Go! (Rachel leaves and Monica calls Mrs. Green.) (To Phoebe) Wait a minute! If you’re in charge of the invitations why am I the one who has to call her—Hello Mrs. Green! Hi, it’s Monica Geller.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, hello Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, umm I know this is last minute, but we’ve decided to throw an impromptu baby shower for Rachel today.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I know, my daughter’s told me about it when they received their impromptu invitations a month ago.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’m sorry. I’m-I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: For what dear? For not inviting me or lying about it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, my ass is sweating! (on phone) Please! Please! Can you come? It’s today at four.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well all right. I’ll see you at four.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Isn’t it at three?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Son of a bitch! (Calls Mrs. Green again.)

content.description: Joey’s Apartment, Joey is reading a script as Ross and Chandler enter carrying a basketball.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joe! You wanna shoot some hoops?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, I can’t go. I’m practicing; I got an audition to be the host of a new game show.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh cool!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, and if I get it by day I’ll (In a sexy voice) Dr. Drake Remoray, but by night I’ll be (In an announcer’s voice) Joey Trrrribbiani!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’ll be perfect for this! That’s already your name!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But the audition’s in a couple hours and I don’t even understand the game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well do you want some help?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh really? That’d be great! You guys can be the contestants!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Awesome!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I guess we can lose to junior high girls some other time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Let’s play Bamboozled!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bamboozled?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, isn’t that a cool name?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Uhh, okay. Our first contestant is Ross Geller. Why don’t you tell us a little something about you Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well uh, I-I’m a paleontologist. Umm, I-I live in New York. I have a son Ben. Uh, hi Ben! (Waves.) And uh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I said a little bit Ross. Now, how about you Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well Joey, I’m a headhunter. I hook up out of work Soviet scientists with rogue third-world nations. Hi Rasputin! (Waves.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent! Let’s play Bamboozled! Chandler, you’ll go first. What is the capital of Columbia?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bogota.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s Ba-go-ta, but close enough. Now, you can either pass your turn to Ross or pick a Wicked Wango card.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does a Wicked Wango card do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I should know that. Let’s see, just one moment please. Umm, here we are, a Wicked Wango card determines whether you go higher or lower.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Higher or lower than what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is embarrassing. (Looks it up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you believe how lame this is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, I don’t believe contestants are allowed to talk to each other.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel’s baby shower is underway. Monica and Phoebe are working in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I told the stripper to be here at five. That’s good right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You ordered a stripper for the shower?! That is totally inappropriate!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? He’s gonna be dressed as a baby! (Mrs. Green enters.) Oh hi Mrs. Green!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m so glad you could make it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, thank you so much. And again, we’re so sorry. We could not feel worse about it.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Try. There’s my little girl. (Goes over to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s still mad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I know. Isn’t it great? One less person we have to make small talk with.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, Sandra’s mad at you too. It-it doesn’t bother you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No look, we’ve apologized twice! I can’t do anymore than that. I know you hate it when people are mad at you but you just have to be okay with it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I can do that. (Pause) I gotta go powder my ass.
[Cut to Rachel and Mrs. Green.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Look at that face! Just like when you were in high school! If I didn’t know better I’d say you were a cheerleader in trouble. Come on, let’s get some tea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Mrs. Green helps her up and they walk over and get some tea.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh my look at that. Only three weeks to go, now have you picked your nanny yet? Now I don’t want you to use your housekeeper ‘cause it would just split her focus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well actually gonna use a nanny and uh, I don’t even have a housekeeper.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: It’s like you’re a cave person. Rachel, you must get a nanny. You don’t know how overwhelming this is going to be. I mean when you were a baby I had full time help, I had Mrs. Kay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mrs. Kay! Oh yeah, she was sweet. She taught me Spanish. I actually think I remember some of it, tu madre es loca. (I think that’s your mother’s crazy.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Such a sweet woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, however great she was I just can’t afford that.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I just had the greatest idea! I’m gonna come live with you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh-wh-what? What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, I’m so happy I’m gonna do this for my little girl. Aw, look at you. You have tears in your eyes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Yes I do.

content.description: Joey’s Apartment, the guys are still playing Bamboozled.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right Ross you’re in the lead, would you like to take another question or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The wheel has not been my friend tonight Joey. Uh, I’ll take another question.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, this is gonna be tough. Hold your breath.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s okay, I’m ready.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No dude, you gotta hold your breath until you’re ready to answer the question.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is ridiculous, he’s not gonna hold his breath… (Ross cuts him off by taking a deep breath and holding it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, what do you have a fear of if you suffer from this phobia, Tris…Holy cow, that’s a big word. Trisc… Seriously look at this thing. Chandler, how do you say that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me see that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This one right here. (Ross whines.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Triscadecaphobia.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The fear of Triscuts !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, fear of the number 13.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fear of Triscuts ?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s possible, they have really sharp edges.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right Chandler, you’re up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, I-I believe I’m entitled to use my Angel Pass for a free turn?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This game makes no sense!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? You’re just upset because you’re losing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on Ross, I think we’re all losers here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Chandler, you can either spin the wheel or pick a Google card.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me think. Let me think—Oh! I don’t care.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You-you must choose Mr. Bing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Either, it makes no difference.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Choose, you jackass!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll take a card.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, you picked the Gimmie card! You get all of Ross’s points!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This game is kinda fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t think it’s a little crazy that you get all my points just ‘cause you…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think the contestants are supposed to speak to each other.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the baby shower is continuing as Rachel walks over to Monica and Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why did you invite my mother?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She wants to move in with me and Ross to help take care of the baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: For how long?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Eight weeks. I mean I love my mother, but my God, a long lunch with her is taxing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I personally would be honored if she wanted to live with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She can’t hear you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? You guys, come on! What am I going to do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if you don’t want your mother to move in with you, just tell her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re right. You’re right. I mean I’m about to have a baby, I can tell my mother that I don’t want her to just be sleeping on my couch! Oh my God! She’s gonna want to sleep in my bed with me. This cannot happen!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. That is right, you go over there and tell her you don’t want her to live with you. Do not take no for an answer!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (She goes over to tell her mother.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is great! Now she’s gonna be mad at Rachel! Y’know what? And I’m just gonna swoop in there and be like the daughter she never had.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have new respect for Chandler. All right everybody! It’s time to open the presents!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Yes! And I think that the first gift that Rachel opens should be from the grandmother of the baby, because you’re the most important person in this room. And in the world!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well uh, I don’t have a gift because I wasn’t invited until the last minute, but thank you so much for bringing that to everyone’s attention.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How about you less important people, let’s open your presents!
(Mrs. Green goes into the kitchen and Rachel follows her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mom that’s okay that you didn’t get you a gift!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well, I kinda did. Me. Eight weeks of me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. Okay, see mom, the truth is I can do this on my own.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Sweetheart I know you’re gonna be terrific mom, I just think you need a little help, especially at the beginning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But mom, I really know what I’m doing. I can handle this.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Really? Remember Twinkles?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He was a hamster! I am not going to vacuum up my baby!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, come on Rach it’s present time! Y’know you’re the glue that’s holding this whole party together. It’s kinda falling apart here.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh look.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this is from your friend at work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my gosh! Oh wow! Oh, I know what this is! (She’s holding an item with a large suction cup connected to a yellow plastic box, with a long narrow tube and bottle connected the yellow part.) Wait a minute. That can’t be right. Is that a beer bong for a baby?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Darling, that’s a breast pump!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did I say I was done guessing? Okay, thank you for that. Oh wow! What’s this?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: It’s a diaper genie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it dispenses clean diapers!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: No! It’s where you put the dirty ones!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that’s gross, why don’t you just take it outside and throw it in a dumpster?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh you’re gonna do that ten times a day?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! It goes ten times a day! What are we feeding this baby?! Indian food?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: No dear, that’s what babies do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, listen to your mother. She is very smart.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Plus, what are you planning on doing with the baby while you’re trotting out to the garbage ten times a day?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I’d leave it on the changing table? (Everyone gasps.) What?! What’d I do? What’d I do?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You can’t leave a baby alone!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh come—(Stutters)—Of course I know that. I mean of course you never leave a baby alone! I mean who would—she wouldn’t be safe as she would be with me, the baby dummy. Oh God, okay. Y’know what? I think opening the presents right now is a little overwhelming right now. So I think umm, I’m just gonna maybe open them a little bit later, but thank you all for coming. And for these beautiful gifts, and this basket is beautiful.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: It’s actually a bassinet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay mommy, don’t ever leave me. (Hugs her.)

content.description: Joey’s Apartment, the guys are still playing the game only everyone is really into it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In what John Houston film would you hear this line, “Badges? We don’t need no stinkin’ badges!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Treasure of the Sierra Madre !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Correct! There’s a possible backwards bonus!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Madre Sierra the of Treasure!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d like to go up the ladder of chance to the golden mud hut please.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wise choice, how many rungs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Six!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That noise can only me one thing.
content.parenthetical: makes a sound like a monkey

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hungry monkey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hungry monkey! (To Chandler) Haaa! (To Joey) I’d like a Wicked Wango card!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, it’s an audio question, name this television theme song. (Starts humming the theme to I Dream of Genie .)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (Pause) Oh! Oh my God! Okay, I know this, give me-give me a second!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tell it to the Time Turtle!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shut up! I Dream of Genie !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yes, you’re back in the lead!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’d like to spin the wheel!
(Joey makes a sound like a game show wheel spinning with the pointer bouncing off of the bars on the wheel as it slows and comes to a stop.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! All right! Uh, umm, Super-Speedy Speed round!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is there a hopping bonus?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course!
(Ross gets up and starts to hop on one leg.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who invented bifocals?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ben Franklin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Correct! Which monarch has ruled Great Britain the longest?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Queen Victoria.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Correct again! But, you forgot to switch legs between questions, so no hopping bonus!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Noooo!!! Every time!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, over to Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d like a Google Card.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! (Pause) No! (Pause) Google!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! Congratulations Ross, because Chandler, you’ve been Bamboozled!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nooo!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is the best game ever!!!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the baby shower has ended and everyone except for Mrs. Green have left who is talking to Rachel while Monica and Phoebe are cleaning up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So umm, you’re gonna stay with me as long as I need you?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Of course I am!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh mom, I swear I’m not an idiot. I’ve read all kinds of books on pregnancy and giving birth, but I-I just didn’t think to read the part about what to do when the baby comes. And-and then guess what? The baby’s coming and I don’t know what to do. Oh, can I throw up in my diaper genie?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: No. Sweetie, you’re gonna be fine. (Starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait-wait where are you going? Where are you going?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I’m going to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Now don’t worry! Everything’s gonna be okay. (Hugs Rachel while she is standing and Rachel is sitting, seeing this Monica decides to join in on the hugging by hugging Mrs. Green from behind her back.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is going to be okay! (Mrs. Green glances over her shoulder and glares at Monica while she heads for the bathroom.) It was worth a shot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Why are you all red and sweaty?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just Bamboozled Chandler! (Flexes in victory while everyone stares at him.) Which is not uh sexual thing. That was a quick shower.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not if you were here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! It looks like we got a lot of good stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh we did, but my mom got us the greatest gift of all.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A Play-Dough Barber Shop?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. She’s going to live with us for eight weeks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! She’s gonna help us take care of the baby! Woo-hoo. (Sees that Ross isn’t happy.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What—You’re not serious. I mean she’s a very nice woman, but there is no way we can take eight weeks of her. She’ll drive us totally crazy.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Hi Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi roomie! (Hugs her and looks at Rachel.)

content.description: Joey’s Audition, Joey is being shown in.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Hey Joey, hi! I’m Ray; I’m the producer of the show.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s a pleasure to meet you Ray.

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: And this is Duncan (points to the cameraman) and Erin, they’re gonna help us out with the audition. So uh, let’s get the camera rolling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rightie-O Ray!

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: Whenever you’re ready.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello, I’m Joey Tribbiani! Let’s play Bamboozled! Erin, you get the first question! In hockey, who is known as The Great One?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Wayne Gretzky.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Correct! Now, would you like to pick a Wicked Wango card or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: Uh Joey, didn’t your agents give you the revised rules? We’ve eliminated all of that. No wheel, no cards.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What—Why?!

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: Uh well, the game was too complicated and research showed people didn’t follow it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well what’s complicated? You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey; you yank his tail and boom! You’re in Paradise Pond!

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: Yeah all that’s gone. It’s basically just a simple question and answer game now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well what’s fun about that? You expect me to be the host of a boring game that’s just people standing around answering questions?

content.speaker: Ray
content.text: Well, there’ll be women in bikinis holding up the scores.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s play Bamboozled!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Mrs. Green is telling Ross what needs to be done to baby proof his apartment.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: …and all those dinosaur nick-knacks you have Ross, I thought they might be more at home in the garage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well we…we don’t have a garage.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Did I say garage? I meant garbage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? Maybe, Mrs. Green, it’s not absolutely vital that you live with us.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well Rachel needs help with the baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I do. I really do. I don’t know anything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m-I’m sure that’s not true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no? Pheebs? Monica? Do I know anything about babies?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, not a thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s frightening.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well uh, y’know what? Even if she doesn’t know anything, I do! I have a son. And his mother and I didn’t live together, and whenever he was with me I took care of him all the time, by myself.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: That’s true. You do have another child.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: With another woman. Have you no control Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a different issue. Uh, the point is, when the baby comes I will be there to…to feed her and bathe her and change her. And more than that I want to do all those things.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well then you really don’t need me to live with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Yes, you’re gonna be so missed.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You’re gonna be a great father.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well you’re gonna be a wonderful grandma. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello?! I still don’t know what the hell I’m doing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on, every first time mother feels that way. You’ll—you’re gonna pick it up. (Rachel doesn’t believe that.) Hey! You will! Uh look, y’know when you first came to the city? You were this spoiled helpless little girl who-who still used daddy’s credit card. Do you remember?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I hope you’re going somewhere with this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at you! What—You’re-you’re this big executive! You are much more capable than you give yourself credit for. I-I have no doubt you’re gonna be an incredible mother.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (Hugs him.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: All right you two, I’m gonna get going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (Rachel and he start to stand up.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no sweetheart, you stay put. I’ll let myself out. It’s like I’m not here, which I almost wasn’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re still so funny. You’re so funny. (To Phoebe) What do I do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing! You have apologized to her like a million times and she’s been nothing but terrible to you. And don’t forget you just threw her daughter a lovely, albeit slightly boring, shower, and she hasn’t even thanked you for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? You’re-you’re right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I mean if you want to say anything to her, I’d tell her off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! I will! Mrs. Green? Mrs. Green! (She ignores Monica and Monica follows her out into the hall with Phoebe in tow.) It is rude to leave a party without saying good-bye to the host! Yeah, and-and also when someone apologizes to you the decent thing to do is to accept it! Now what I did to you, it wasn’t on purpose! But what you’re during to me now is just plain spiteful!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Spiteful?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right! Maybe it’s time you took a good hard look at a mirror young lady…old lady…lady!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wrap it up, wrap it up, wrap it up…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So whenever you’re ready to apologize to me, I will forgive you. Good day! (Monica and Phoebe reenter the apartment and Monica closes the door on a stunned Mrs. Green.) I can’t feel my legs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You were fantastic! I’m so proud of you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah? I’m proud of me too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You should be!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah could-could-could you get me something to drink?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You got it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (When Phoebe turns around Monica runs out into the hall after Mrs. Green.) Mrs. Green! Okay I’m really sorry!! I’m apologizing for the—(She trips and falls down the stairs.) (Pause) Okay, I bit my tongue, but I’m still really sorry!

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Ross is helping Rachel study for when the baby comes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! I’m ready.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You sure?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I’ve done my studying and I really know my stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right then. (Gets up, in an announcer’s voice) Rachel Green! Let’s play Bamboozled! (Reading from a note card.) How do you test the temperature of the baby’s bath water?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, put your elbow in it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excellent! How do you put a baby down for a nap?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s correct! This is an audio question, what do you do when the baby makes this sound? (Makes a sound like someone is choking a cat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Check if it’s wet, check if it’s hungry, burp it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excellent! Excellent, now-now do you want another question or a Wicked Wango card?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A card! A card! I pick a card!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry you’ve been Bamboozled! You’re gonna be a terrible mother! (Rachel stares at him agape.) I’ve lost sight of why we’re doing this! (Rachel gets up and walks away.)
End
